subject: RE: [junit] Re: Creating JUnit class using WSAD, Help Required !!!!!
msgSnippet: Hi Dipta, I use Eclipse 3.0 M9 which is very much the same as WSAD.  U simply right click on the class for which u want to create a JUnit class and then go to
messageBody:
Hi Dipta,

I use Eclipse 3.0 M9 which is very much the same as WSAD. U simply right
click on the class for which u want to create a JUnit class and then go to
New option and it should give u an option to create a JUnit test case.

Regards

Khurram


>From: "junit_user2004" <junit_user2004@...>
>Reply-To: junit@yahoogroups.com

>Date: Thu, 05 Aug 2004 08:41:10 -0000

>dont know how to write test classes for my java files using WSAD.

>WSAD for writing Junit test classes.
>regds,
>Dipta keshari
>

>your
